description.narrative: The Programme facilitates access by GBV survivors to quality GBV response and prevention services, and ensures GBV survivors are empowered to break the cycle of abuse

participating-org.narrative: MPTF-Phase Il GRZ-UN Joint Programme on Gender-Based Violence in Zambia
MPTFO-Joint Programme for the Gender Based Violence in Zambia

sector.narrative: Eradicate poverty in all its forms and dimensions

description.narrative: Output 1 - Target Districts have increased capacity to deliver co-ordinated GBV services Indicator 1.1 - # of hospital based One Stop Centres (OSC) established strengthened/established and functional in the project districts Indicator 1.2 - # of community structures conducting dialogues and info sessions on GBV services and prevention Indicator 1.3 - # of OSCs which are child friendly Indicator 1.4 - # of service providers trained on multi-disciplinary GBV guidelines (disaggregated by type of service provider and sex) Output 2 - GBV survivors have increased access to safe shelters, and child victims of violence have care plans in place and access to family based alternative care settings Indicator 2.1 - # of GBV survivors housed in project supported shelters Indicator 2.2 - # of shelters established/strengthened for temporary housing of GBV survivors Indicator 2.3 - # of child GBV survivors supported to access alternative care options through case management Output 3 - Target districts have increased capacity to deliver quality legal services Indicator 3.1 - # of Fast-Track Courts (FTCs) established/strengthened and functional Indicator 3.2 - % of FTCs that are operating in line with child friendly satndards Indicator 3.3 - # of legal service providers trained Indicator 3.4 - # of GBV survivors provided with legal aid Output 4 - GBV survivors and those at risk access economic empowerment services Indicator 4.1 - # of GBV survivors and those at risk capacitated in business development Indicator 4.2 - # of GBV survivors and those at risk provided with enterprise start up support Indicator 4.3 - # of savings and credit groups (formal and informal) supported to "start/improve" Indicator 4.4 - # of women and girls capacitated with ICT knowledge Output 5.0 - Community and traditional leadership structures have capacity to mobilise on GBV prevention Indicator 5.1 - # of traditional, religious, and political leaders and spouses sensitised on GBV Indicator 5.2 - # of peopl

comment.narrative: The Baseline study is currently being developed: Therefore Output 1 - Baseline indicators to be determined Output 2 - Baseline indicators to be determined Output 3 - Baseline indicators to be determined Output 4 - Baseline indicators to be determined Output 5 - Baseline indicators to be determined Output 6 - Baseline indicators to be determined

During 2020 the following were the targets: Under Output 1 - Target Districts have increased capacity to deliver co-ordinated GBV services ndicator 1.1 - 5 hospital based One Stop Centres (OSC) established strengthened/established and functional in the project districts Indicator 1.2 - 20 of community structures conducting dialogues and info sessions on GBV services and prevention Indicator 1.3 - # of OSCs which are child friendly Indicator 1.4 - # of service providers trained on multi-disciplinary GBV guidelines (disaggregated by type of service provider and sex)
Output 2 - GBV survivors have increased access to safe shelters, and child victims of violence have care plans in place and access to family based alternative care settings Indicator 2.1 - # of GBV survivors housed in project supported shelters Indicator 2.2 - # of shelters established/strengthened for temporary housing of GBV survivors Indicator 2.3 - # of child GBV survivors supported to access alternative care options through case management Output 3 - Target districts have increased capacity to deliver quality legal services Indicator 3.1 - # of Fast-Track Courts (FTCs) established/strengthened and functional Indicator 3.2 - % of FTCs that are operating in line with child friendly satndards Indicator 3.3 - # of legal service providers trained Indicator 3.4 - # of GBV survivors provided with legal aid
Output 4 - GBV survivors and those at risk access economic empowerment services ndicator 4.1 - # of GBV survivors and those at risk capacitated in business development Indicator 4.2 - # of GBV survivors and those at risk provided with enterprise start up support Indicator 4.3 - # of savings and credit groups (formal and informal) supported to "start/improve" Indicator 4.4 - # of women and girls capacitated with ICT knowledge Output 5 - Community and traditional leadership structures have capacity to mobilise on GBV prevention Indicator 5.1 - # of traditional, religious, and political leaders and spouses sensitised on GBV Indicator 5.2 - # of people participating in community structures trained on GBV prevention (disaggregated by type of structure, age and sex) Output 6 - Improve multi-sectoral co-ordination and governance related to GBV prevention and response Indicator 6.1 - # of district plans mainstreaming GBV Indicator 6.2 - # of policies/guidelines finalised Indicator 6.3 - # of service delivery points tracking GBV data on an MIS Indicator 6.4 - # of Project Steering Committees Held Indicator 6.5 - # of joint review and planning meetings held

During 2020 the following were the results/achievements: Under Output 1 - Target Districts have increased capacity to deliver co-ordinated GBV services Indicator 1.1 - 10 hospital based One Stop Centres (OSC) established strengthened/established and functional in the project districts, 2 of which are VLOSC Indicator 1.2 - 35 community structures conducting dialogues and info sessions on GBV services and prevention Indicator 1.3 - 0 OSCs which are child friendly Indicator 1.4 - 429 service providers trained on multi-disciplinary GBV guidelines (disaggregated by type of service provider and sex)
Output 2 - GBV survivors have increased access to safe shelters, and child victims of violence have care plans in place and access to family based alternative care settings Indicator 2.1 - 74 GBV survivors housed in project supported shelters Indicator 2.2 - 7 shelters strengthened for temporary housing of GBV survivors, 0 refurbished/rehabilitated Indicator 2.3 - 29 child GBV survivors supported to access alternative care options through case management Output 3 - Target districts have increased capacity to deliver quality legal services Indicator 3.1 - 6 of Fast-Track Courts (FTCs) strengthened, 0 FTCs constructed and functional Indicator 3.2 - 0 - % of FTCs that are operating in line with child friendly standards Indicator 3.3 - 486 legal service providers trained Indicator 3.4 - 130 GBV survivors provided with legal aid
Output 4 - GBV survivors and those at risk access economic empowerment services ndicator 4.1 - 569 GBV survivors and those at risk capacitated in business development Indicator 4.2 - 319 GBV survivors and those at risk provided with enterprise start up support Indicator 4.3 - 0 GBV survivors and those at risk engaged in savings and credit groups Indicator 4.4 - 0 savings and credit groups (formal and informal) supported to "start/improve" Indicator 4.4 - 35 women and girls capacitated with ICT knowledge Output 5 - Community and traditional leadership structures have capacity to mobilise on GBV prevention Indicator 5.1 - 567 traditional, religious, and political leaders and spouses sensitised on GBV Indicator 5.2 - 158,102 people participating in community structures trained on GBV prevention (disaggregated by type of structure, age and sex) Output 6 - Improve multi-sectoral co-ordination and governance related to GBV prevention and response Indicator 6.1 - 20 district plans mainstreaming GBV Indicator 6.2 - 2 policies/guidelines finalised Indicator 6.3 - 2 service delivery points tracking GBV data on an MIS Indicator 6.4 - 2 Project Steering Committees Held Indicator 6.5 - 7 joint review and planning meetings held (3 physical 4 virtual)

During 2021 the following were the targets: Under Output 1 - Target Districts have increased capacity to deliver co-ordinated GBV services Indicator 1.1 - 5 hospital based One Stop Centres (OSC) established strengthened/established and functional in the project districts, Indicator 1.2 - 30 of community structures conducting dialogues and info sessions on GBV services and prevention Indicator 1.3 - 3 OSCs which are child friendly Indicator 1.4 - 350 service providers trained on multi-disciplinary GBV guidelines (disaggregated by type of service provider and sex)
Output 2 - GBV survivors have increased access to safe shelters, and child victims of violence have care plans in place and access to family based alternative care settings Indicator 2.1 - 60 GBV survivors housed in project supported shelters Indicator 2.2 - 10 shelters established/strengthened for temporary housing of GBV survivors Indicator 2.3 - 30 child GBV survivors supported to access alternative care options through case management Output 3 - Target districts have increased capacity to deliver quality legal services Indicator 3.1 - 3 Fast-Track Courts (FTCs) established/strengthened and functional Indicator 3.2 - 20% FTCs that are operating in line with child friendly standards Indicator 3.3 - 400 legal service providers trained Indicator 3.4 - 100 GBV survivors provided with legal aid
Output 4 - GBV survivors and those at risk access economic empowerment services Indicator 4.1 - 700 GBV survivors and those at risk capacitated in business development Indicator 4.2 - 650 GBV survivors and those at risk provided with enterprise start up support Indicator 4.3 - 400 GBV survivors and those at risk engaged in savings and credit groups Indicator 4.4 - 100 savings and credit groups (formal and informal) supported to "start/improve" Indicator 4.5 - 50 women and girls capacitated with ICT knowledge Output 5 - Community and traditional leadership structures have capacity to mobilise on GBV prevention Indicator 5.1 - 300 traditional, religious, and political leaders and spouses sensitised on GBV Indicator 5.2 - 80,000 people participating in community structures trained on GBV prevention (disaggregated by type of structure, age and sex) Output 6 - Improve multi-sectoral co-ordination and governance related to GBV prevention and response Indicator 6.1 - 20 district plans mainstreaming GBV Indicator 6.2 - 3 policies/guidelines finalised Indicator 6.3 - 2 service delivery points tracking GBV data on an MIS Indicator 6.4 - 2 Project Steering Committees Held Indicator 6.5 - 5 joint virtual and physical review and planning meetings held
